newsitem.title: UK: Fedex to acquire ex-American, United DC-10s.
newsitem.headline: Fedex to acquire ex-American, United DC-10s.

text.p: Federal Express Corp said it would conclude "in the next few days" a multi-million dollar deal to acquire up to 50 second-hand McDonnell Douglas DC-10-10s from American Airlines and United Airlines.

Company vice-president James Parker told Reuters that all the aircraft would be converted to cargo configuration by their original manufacturer, McDonell Douglas, at the latter's Longbeach, California, facility.
Fedex already operates a fleet of 13 DC-10-10s and 22 DC-10-30s conversions on its domestic U.S. services.
Parker, who is responsible for fleet development and acquisition, said the principals "were hammering out mutually acceptable terms" before work started on converting the 50 tri-jets to freight use.
The additional aircraft will also be used for US domestic express service.
The conversion purchase comes in the wake of Fedex's announcement that it would buy 11 more Airbus Industrie A300-600 freighters for delivery between 1998 and 2000.
Fedex also said earlier today that it might eventually be interested in a freighter version of a super-jumbo if this comes into service. --Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax +44 171 542 5017
